alert.note: Alert for Clay (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 12 at 9:56PM CDT until April 16 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Minnesota...North Dakota... Red River of the North at Wahpeton affecting Wilkin and Richland Counties. South Branch Buffalo River at Sabin affecting Clay County. Buffalo River near Hawley affecting Clay County. Wild Rice River (MN) at Hendrum affecting Norman County. Red Lake River at Crookston affecting Polk County. Two Rivers River near Hallock affecting Kittson County. Wild Rice River (ND) near Abercrombie affecting Richland County. Maple River near Mapleton (South of I-94) affecting Cass County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota...North Dakota... Red River of the North at Fargo affecting Cass and Clay Counties. Buffalo River near Dilworth affecting Clay County. Red River of the North at East Grand Forks affecting Polk and Grand Forks Counties. Red River of the North at Pembina affecting Kittson and Pembina Counties. Red River of the North at Drayton affecting Marshall, Kittson, Walsh and Pembina Counties. Red River of the North at Oslo affecting Walsh, Marshall, Polk and Grand Forks Counties. .River rises continue once again due to preceding snowfall and rainfall. The ongoing snow storm will likely contribute to further rises, the extent of which is still uncertain. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Buffalo River near Dilworth. * WHEN...Until Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, MINOR FLOOD STAGE. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 13.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 13.3 feet early Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
